markdownRemark.html:
508 Office / Vets.gov Monthly

2017-06-05

Participants:

  • DSVA: Suzanne, Raquel
  • 508 Office: Dandy Diddle, Angela Gant-Curtis, Christopher Walker, and others

Vets.gov

Suzanne/Dan:

  • concerned about how far behind we are on the comprehensive list of products (~20)
  • recommendation from Angela: vets.gov creates a weekly priority list with top 1-2 products about to be released (or some other criteria?)
  • 508 office will try to get to the top 1-2 on Fridays, which they usually set aside to log on and give a smoke test to give some indication of where they stand
  • because vets.gov is so agile, can never get through entire list
  • for the few vets.gov products they've tested recently, not finding many issues (though see below VCL issue reported by a user)

Raquel:

  • our automated tests currently run against the aXe Section 508 rule set, but we are gradually upgrading all tests to also satisfy the WCAG 2.0 rule set
  • 508 office glad to hear that; they too would like to raise their standards to comply with WCAG 2.0 standards but will probably get there in late 2017
  • also makes 508 office less concerned about the backlog of products to manually test if they know our automated tests are strict

  • gave a few example issues we've been catching during the rule set upgrade:

    • an aria attribute referring to an element that's not yet in the DOM
    • a duplicate element ID or stray div inside a <ul>...all easy fixes
    • tracking issue: https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets.gov-team/issues/2198
  • 508 folks interested in hearing when vets.gov has been updated to meet WCAG 2.0 standards so that they can use it as an example for other products (exact words were so they can brag about it on our behalf)

Veterans Crisis Line (VCL)

  • need to fix veterans crisis line link (report updated on 6/2)
  • sent to Suzanne and Raquel via email
  • (Raquel: just dug up https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets.gov-team/issues/2961 and self-assigned)

EOAS Pre-needs POAM Angela's working on

  • tl;dr no action required from vets.gov--this is a backend system that vets.gov relies on
  • 3 issues filed
  • Angela has POAM draft had 2 dates for remediation in June; another for July
  • supposedly fixed last week so are not going to file the POAM
  • however, Chris could not run a report because there was no test data
  • Pat: we don't need a POAM on an interim build; will place on backlog of next build
  • If not a final build, better to minimize paperwork since getting POAM approved will take longer than get
    ting the final build out

Caseflow / Appeals

  • dequeue worldspace audit; in past, does an automated scan; last one seen was back in March
  • dequeue products are being moved to manual audit for the next few months
  • he's moving 45 products into a list of products for manual audit
  • his list says there was a product called "VA Appeals": Dan needs to confirm what the product is, a url to point his team at, etc.
